body:
Many stdlib libraries and functions work with byteslices. It's bothered me for quite some time that our stdlib version of HTML escaping only works for strings. I feel that it's a point of common non-needed allocations. 

I feel that the stdlib implementation of EscapeString is perfect for it's use-case. I am looking to add the option of EscapeBytes so that we no longer have to hobble around using only strings when escaping.
